job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Roseau, MN
cons: lack of career advancement opportunities in the past

pros: flexibilty with schedule, good PTO package
cons: not easy to advance in career

job_title: Director of Nursing in Roseau, MN
pros: Lots of great benefits and management
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: Management needs to stop the nepotism and favoritism shown throughout the hospital.
pros:
Friendly staff. Clean working environment. 

Over the past few years they have been outsourcing more and more. Most Doctors are not employees. EMR system is outsourced to a competitor.  At times directors are outsourced. It appears they may be planning to merge or be purchased by a competitor. The board of directors continue to vote yes to allow more outsourcing.
cons: I would like to stay positive but employee morale has gone down rapidly over the past few years. Upper management has issues leading by example.  They don't follow up with issues and have a mind set that is not their job.  Knee jerk reactions to issues because off lack of knowledge.

pros: Friendly staff, good pay, flexible scheduling, yearly pay raises, good benefits, night and weekend bonus pay, holiday pay, lots of overtime
cons: Working with difficult patients, staff shortages, low bed count, nursing home workload, lots of continuing education classes, lots of gossip amongst some staff

pros: This employer provides a great culture, environment, pay and benefits.   The company is consistently focused on employee satisfaction and retention.
cons: The facility is located in a small rural city in northern MN, which can be both a Pro and Com.

job_title: Business Office Manager in Kansas City, KS
cons: Corporate management needs to visit the facilities more often to ensure their policies and proceedures are being followed

pros: Opportunity for travel, learn knew things and experience new xultures
cons: Offer better benefits. Ensure employees are able to take the PTO they earn.

pros: They were all nice and friendly. Great work place!
cons: I wish I could have had more hours but I was in school, so that was my fault.
